item.title: Sean Penn Let Himself Get Away With Things for 15 Years. Not Anymore.
item.description: The actor and instigator is ready for his renaissance.

item.title: I’m Concerned About Sweatshops. Should It Change What I Buy?
item.description: How to balance a concern for human rights with concern for those who depend on jobs in overseas factories?

item.title: What the Public Memory of Charlie Kirk Revealed
item.description: For those who felt denigrated by his rhetoric, the bipartisan tributes to him as a champion of free speech augured something dangerous: the mainstreaming of formerly extremist views.

item.title: Want to Know What Men Are Thinking? Go Get a Haircut.
item.description: The version of masculinity you might see getting your hair cut is more complex than the caricature presented in the manosphere.

item.title: The L.A. Dodgers Risk Alienating Their Fans or Angering Trump
item.description: For decades, the Dodgers have been the pride of L.A.’s Latino community. Trump’s immigration raids are testing that.

item.title: This Classic Sushi Roll Is a Delight to Make at Home
item.description: The California roll is so much more than the sum of its parts. It’s also easily made in your kitchen.

item.title: The Case for Laughing With Strangers in the Dark
item.description: Hollywood often leaves humor to the TV screen. But months of moviegoing reminded me: A good comedy gets as much out of the theater as any IMAX spectacular.

item.title: Can Your Spouse Put Limits on Knuckle-Cracking?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over body noises.

item.title: Sen. Alex Padilla Says His Viral Moment Was a Sign of Things to Come
item.description: The California politician on his “wake-up call” at an earlier moment of political upheaval, and the one he’s experiencing today.

item.title: I’m a Screenwriter. Is It All Right if I Use A.I.?
item.description: This new tool has been a game changer.

item.title: A Green Beret’s Confession Outraged the Military. Then He Found an Ally in Trump.
item.description: The president’s pardon of Mathew Golsteyn cut short an investigation into his killing of a man he believed to be a Taliban bombmaker. Was justice served?

item.title: ‘Bow to the Emperor’: We Asked 50 Legal Experts About the Trump Presidency
item.description: Before the election, we surveyed the legal establishment about what a second Trump term could mean for the rule of law. A year later, they’re very, very worried.

item.title: Lie About Your Age. It’s Fun!
item.description: Free, easy and old-fashioned, lying is an anti-aging supplement for the masses.

item.title: They Got to Live a Life of Luxury. Then Came the Fine Print.
item.description: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ has built a delirious new culture of consumption — and trapped users in a vortex of debt.
